section.name: URLEncode
section.p: The URLEncode task will encode a given property for use within a a URL string. This value which is actually set will be encoded via the java.net.URLEncoder.encode() method. Typically, you must do this for all parameter values within a URL.

tr.td: The name of the property to set.
If the property is already set, should we change it's value. Can be true or false

The location of a file whose absolute path will be the value of the property.
No, if value or refid is specified.
The id of a saved reference whose value will be the value of the property.

subsection.name: Example
subsection.p: would set the "file.location" property to the value: C%3A%5Cwwwhome%5Cmy+reports%5Creport.xml which could then be used in a URL.
